concise_definition: v. 坚持, 遵守, 粘附

definitions.explanation_en: To remain loyal to or follow a belief, principle, plan, or set of rules, often despite pressure to change.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指坚持某种信念、原则、计划或规则，即使面临改变的压力也不动摇。
definitions.example_en: She is adhering to her diet strictly, even during the holidays.
definitions.example_cn: 即使在节日期间，她也严格遵守自己的饮食计划。

definitions.explanation_en: To stick firmly to a surface, either physically or metaphorically, often through natural or chemical bonding.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指物理上或隐喻上牢固地附着于某表面，通常通过自然或化学作用实现粘附。
definitions.example_en: The paint is adhering well to the wall after proper priming.
definitions.example_cn: 经过适当打底后，油漆很好地附着在墙上。

definitions.explanation_en: To support or align oneself with a group, movement, or cause, often implying commitment and active participation.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指支持或与某个团体、运动或事业保持一致，通常暗示着承诺和积极参与。
definitions.example_en: Many young people are adhering to the environmental movement with passionate activism.
definitions.example_cn: 许多年轻人以充满热情的行动主义支持环保运动。

comparison.analysis: “Following” (跟随) 更侧重于行为上的追随或模仿，常用于日常语境，如跟随规则、跟随某人。而 “adhering” 更强调内在的忠诚与坚定承诺，带有更强的道德或原则性色彩，常用于正式或严肃语境。
“Sticking” (粘住/坚持) 是 “adhering” 的非正式同义词，尤其在口语中用于表示坚持立场（如 sticking to your guns），但其语义范围更窄，常仅用于物理粘附或固执坚持，缺乏 “adhering” 所蕴含的系统性、原则性或制度性内涵。
“Complying” (遵守/服从) 通常指因外部压力、规则或权威而被动服从，带有强制性意味。而 “adhering” 更强调主动选择和内在认同，是一种自愿的、积极的坚持，情感色彩更正面。
